alert.note: Alert for Coahoma; Panola; Quitman; Tate; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 10:48PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Coahoma, southeastern Tunica, western Tate, northern Quitman and northwestern Panola Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1048 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dundee, or 14 miles east of Helena-West Helena, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Senatobia, Coldwater, Jonestown, Crenshaw, Sledge, Phillipp, Strayhorn, Dubbs, Dundee, Arkabutla, Little Texas, Lula, Falcon, Askew, Gerlach Mill, Moon, Buxton, Savage, Prichard and Sarah. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for eastern Arkansas...and northwestern Mississippi.
